revised_title: Effects of Reactant Consumption on Critical Local Disturbance of Temperature Field for Ignition
tldr: This article investigates the critical local disturbance of the temperature field necessary for ignition and the effects of reactant consumption. The authors find that a proportionally greater increase in the disturbance is needed when reactant consumption is considered, compared to the classical problem of thermal explosion. The study focuses on a two-dimensional slab of exothermic reactant and uses a series expansion to analyze the dynamics of ignition.
